data.title: Community Foundation for San Benito County
data.meta_site_name: Community Foundation for San Benito County
data.text:
33rd District Agricultural Association

Highlighting the county’s natural and agricultural resources by holding fairs, expositions, and exhibitions that feature various industries, enterprises, resources, and products of San Benito County and neighboring areas.

Adopt My Block

Providing support for homeless pet parents, providing essentials for outdoor dogs, and fostering the ones who need it most.

Advocacy, Inc.

Protecting the civil, legal, and human rights of facility-placed seniors, disabled persons, and individuals with mental health needs through advocacy, education, and intervention.

All Creatures Great and Small Animal Rescue, Inc.

Foster-home based animal rescue that assists in rescuing and sheltering animals that would otherwise be euthanized due to lack of space or special-needs veterinary care.

American Legion Post #69 Auxiliary

To support the American Legion while providing support for our veterans, our military, and their families by shaping a positive future in an atmosphere of fellowship, patriotism, peace, and security.

American Red Cross Northern California Region

Provides help to those affected by disasters and empowers individuals in our community to prepare for, respond to, and recover from emergencies. Collect and distribute lifesaving blood, provide support for active military veterans and their families, and teaches CPR/AED, first aid, aquatics, and other vital skills throughout our region.

Animation Dance Community, Inc.

Exposing everyone of all ages to the fun, healthy, and appropriate world of hip-hop. All genres of hip-hop are taught.

Aromas Community Center Foundation

Providing a local park area with facilities and ground where all, young through young-at-heart, can participate in a variety of outdoor activities.

Aromas Community Grange #361

Nonpartisan political lobbying organization historically focused on protecting the rights of farmers and other small landholders and giving them a political voice.

Aromas Eagles Aerie #72

Uniting fraternally in the spirit of liberty, truth, justice, and equality to make human life in Aromas more desirable by lessening its ills, and by promoting peace, prosperity, gladness, and hope.

ASSERT - Drone Animal Rescue

Created to serve the integral needs of all animals before, during, and in the aftermath of natural disasters.

Baler Backers Athletic Organization

Dedicated to improving the athletic experiences of every student-athlete at San Benito High School by providing financial support to the teams and Athletic Department.

Baler Education Foundation

The mission of the Baler Education Foundation is to provide resources, through community partnerships, to support and enhance educational programs and opportunities in San Benito High School District.

Breast Cancer Assistance Group of Monterey County

An all-volunteer organization of breast cancer survivors who raise funds and awareness to improve the lives of local breast cancer patients and their families.

Bulldog Boxing Gym

To guide and enlighten local at-risk youth by providing a safe environment, opportunity to make friends and build bonds, and encourage further education and strengthening of their bodies.

California Aging and Disability Resource Connection of San Benito County

Serving older individuals, individuals with disabilities, and caregivers with information and access to available long-term services and supports (LTSS) at the local level.

California FarmLink

Linking farmers and ranchers to the land and the financing they need for a sustainable future.

California Warbirds Inc.

To educate, restore, preserve, and make available for public display aircrafts of historical significance in the California Warbirds Air Museum.

CASA of San Benito County

Advocating for abused and neglected children placed in foster care; upholding the children’s rights while pursuing a safe and permanent home.

Catholic Charities Diocese of Monterey

Assisting individuals and families of all backgrounds and beliefs by providing tools, training, resources, and referrals to social service agencies within Monterey, Santa Cruz, San Benito, and San Luis Obispo counties.

Central Coast Center for Independent Living

Promotes independent living and provides advocacy, education, and support to people with disabilities, their family, and the community.

Coalition of Homeless Services Providers

To eliminate homelessness in Monterey and San Benito Counties by promoting regional partnerships and interagency collaboration for a comprehensive system of housing for our diverse population.

Community Foundation for San Benito County

Building a stronger community and enhancing the quality of life for individuals and families in San Benito County by helping to direct charitable giving from generous donors and supporting our local nonprofits.

Community Health Trust of Pajaro Valley

Fostering a healthy and equitable community for all in the Pajaro Valley, along the borders of Santa Cruz, Monterey, and San Benito Counties through leadership in advocacy, collaboration, and wellness.

Community Housing Improvement Systems and Planning Association (CHISPA)

Nonprofit housing developer that builds and renovates homes and apartments for low and moderate-income people in Monterey, San Benito, and Santa Clara Counties.

Community Media Access Partnership (CMAP)

Community media center serving Gilroy, Hollister, and San Juan Bautista. Empowering community members and organizations to thrive in a digital world by providing access to media tools, training, and television distribution on local cable channels.

Community Solutions

Providing a spectrum of prevention, intervention, treatment, and residential services to the communities of Santa Clara and San Benito Counties in mental health, substance abuse, trauma, severe family dysfunction, sexual and domestic violence, and human trafficking.

Cooper's Calling

Cooper's Calling is a safe, therapeutic riding facility for special needs children. Join us in our journey, where therapy has hooves.

Dentistry4Vets

The mission of Dentistry4Vets is to provide quality dental care and dental hygiene to eligible veterans living in Monterey, Santa Cruz, and San Benito Counties.

Easterseals Central California

Easterseals Central California provides exceptional services, education, outreach, and advocacy so that people living with disabilities can live, learn, work, and play in our communities.

El Teatro Campesino

Multi-generational theater company that has been at the forefront of using theatre as an artistic generator of social change.

Family Matters

Family Matters SBC works in collaboration with the Social Justice System facilitating child access to their incarcerated parent(s) by promoting parental accountability through education and supervised visitation.

For Ferals Sake

For Ferals Sake is an all-volunteer 501c3 non-profit that focuses on alleviating the suffering of feral and community cats in San Benito County through trap neuter return, (TNR), fostering, and rehoming. We are a dedicated few, passionate about improving the well-being of each individual cat we meet, focusing on the best outcome for each one.

Friends of the SBC Free Library

Promoting the welfare and growth of the San Benito County Free Library by providing support to enrich the library’s resources and make its services better known to the community.

Gabilan Chapter Seneca Family of Agencies

Dedicated to the creation, preservation, and support of foster, adoptive and relative families for children who need them.

Girl Scouts of California's Central Coast

Building girls of courage, confidence, and character, who make the world a better place. Girl Scouts of all backgrounds and abilities can be unapologetically themselves as they discover their strengths and rise to meet new challenges.

Girls Inc.

Delivering programs focused on leadership and self-empowerment for girls to equip girls to navigate gender, economic, and social barriers, and grow up healthy, educated, and independent.

Go Kids, Inc.

Providing comprehensive child development services to help a child understand his world, develop independence, and learn to make choices and express creativity.

Green Foothills

Since 1962, Green Foothills has been protecting open space, farmland, and natural resources in San Benito, San Mateo, and Santa Clara Counties for the benefit of all through advocacy, education, and grassroots action.

Grower Shipper Association Foundation

Provides education and information on the agriculture industry as well as offers innovative programs to the community.

Guitars Not Guns

Providing guitars and lessons to foster children and at-risk youth in a classroom setting with qualified teachers as an alternative to violence.

Habitat for Humanity

Helping families build and improve places to call home. We believe affordable housing plays a critical role in strong and stable communities.

Hazel Hawkins Hospital Foundation

Providing financial resources to support Hazel Hawkins Memorial Hospital and all of the facilities in the San Benito Health Care District.

Health Projects Center

Implementing high-quality programs and strategies to address the health and human needs of individuals, families, and communities of California's Central Coast.

Health, Insurance, Counseling & Advocacy Program (HICAP)

HICAP of Santa Cruz and San Benito Counties is a volunteer-supported program within Senior Network Services, a community-based nonprofit agency. HICAP offers its services to anyone who has- or will soon be eligible for Medicare. HICAP also offers services to family members and caregivers of people with Medicare

Hollister Airmen's Association

Enthusiastically celebrating years of serving Hollister Municipal Airport and the community since 1946. Working and collaborating with organizations and community groups on special projects, events, and educational endeavors.

Hollister BlackJacks Fastpitch

Our goal is to elevate the level of play to the highest caliber while encouraging leadership and sportsmanship. Foster growth within a positive environment both on and off the field. Having self-respect and respecting others are our core values.

Hollister Community Outreach

Serving the underserved in San Benito County. Outreach to those in need of food, water, and essential needs

Hollister Cowboys Football and Cheer

Developing well-rounded young men and women who learn not only the fundamentals of football, cheerleading and dance, but also the importance of education in an atmosphere conducive to developing sound mind, body, and character – and having an enjoyable time along the way.

Hollister Elks

Investing in the community with programs that help children grow up healthy and drug-free, undertaking projects that address unmet needs, and honoring the service and sacrifice of veterans.

Hollister Lions Club

Promoting principles of good government and good citizenship by taking an active interest in the civic, cultural, social, and moral welfare of the community.

Hollister Little League

Specializing in youth baseball for those between the ages of 4 through 12.

Hollister Police Department Explorers

Designed as a mentorship program for youth who are interested in pursuing a career in Law Enforcement.

Hollister Pregnancy Center

Licensed medical clinic staffed with trained and caring individuals that can answer your questions, talk about your options and provide you with positive solutions.

Hollister Presbyterian Cooperative Preschool

Offering a program that provides for the development of the whole child and enhances his/her spiritual, emotional, physical, and intellectual growth.

Hollister Rebels Football

To implant firmly into the youths of our community ideals of good sportsmanship, honesty, loyalty, and cheer in San Benito County.

Horsewomen By Grace

For women that love the Lord, horses, and desire to be with women of like minds.

Italian Catholic Federation

Dedicated to promoting activities that build faith and family spirit and bring men, women, and children of all ages together. Active in various cultural events throughout the country, support local parishes, and provide various charities with financial and other support.

JMM Dance Co.

To expand dance education to people of all abilities by providing equity, accessibility, inclusive resources, and exposure to the tools of visual and performing arts for the purpose of self-development.

Junior Achievement

Helping to positively impact young people’s perceptions about the importance of education, as well as critical life skills. Lessons to promote financial capability, work and career readiness, and business ownership.

Kids and Art Foundation

Kids & Art uses the power of the arts and creativity to mitigate stress, anxiety, and trauma induced from the diagnosis and treatment of pediatric cancer and other critical medical conditions.

Kiwanis Club of Hollister

Global organization of volunteers dedicated to improving the world, one child and one community at a time.

Knights of Columbus

Together, we’re empowering Catholic men to live their faith at home, in their parish, at work, and in their community.

Latinas Contra Cancer

Leading service and advocacy organization for Latinos around issues of cancer. Latinas Contra Cancer exists to create equitable and just access to health and the healthcare system.

Life Project

Faith-based organization helping teens transition back into society from incarceration and during probation. Includes a teen recovery program, life skills, tutoring, and many other programs.

Live Like Geno Foundation

To inspire passion, purpose, and positivity in honor of Gene “Geno” Cotter by creating a positive impact in the lives of economically challenged youth through development programs.

MOMS Club of Hollister

The MOMS Club of Hollister is a chapter of MOMS Club International. Members are stay-home moms offering each other support through daytime activities and events.

Monterey Bay Retired Senior Volunteer Program

Connecting caring folks age 55 and up with non-profit agencies that need volunteers. RSVP is a program part of Santa Cruz Volunteer Center that works with individuals and nonprofit agencies in Santa Cruz, Monterey, and San Benito Counties.

My Father's House

To provide for those in need of food, clothing, showers and the Gospel of Jesus Christ

Native Daughters of the Golden West Parlor 179

NDGW is a fraternal & patriotic organization founded on the principles of "Love of Home, Devotion to the Flag, Veneration of the Pioneers, Faith in the Existence of God." Owns & maintains the historic Pico-Boranda Adobe in San Juan Bautista.

Pals4Pits Rescue

Provide for the needs of abandoned, stray and surrendered dogs, train them, and place them in good, loving, forever homes.

Peninsula Family Service

Strengthens our community by providing children, families, and older adults the support and tools to realize their full potential and lead healthy, stable lives.

Pet Friends & Rescue

Nonprofit adoption center that offers loving care for abandoned and homeless pets until they are adopted into their forever family.

Philanthropic Educational Organization (P.E.O.) Chapter WX of Hollister

P.E.O is a philanthropic organization where women celebrate the advancement of women, educate women, and motivate women to achieve their highest aspirations.

REINS – Red’s Equines In Need Sanctuary

An all-volunteer group, focusing on equines in need of rehoming, rehabilitating, or a forever home in a sanctuary.

Rotary Club of Hollister

Service organization of business and professional leaders united worldwide who conduct humanitarian projects, encourage high ethical standards in all vocations, and work toward world understanding and peace.

Rotary Club of San Juan Bautista

Organization made up of local businesses, professional, and civic leaders dedicated to serving throughout our community and around the world.

Sacred Heart School Foundation

Providing opportunities for charitable giving and focusing on financial support for the ongoing needs of Sacred Heart Parish School and students.

Salvation Army Hollister Corps

Doing the most good for the most people in the most need.

San Benito Citizens for a Brighter Future

Grassroots organization that supports economic growth in San Benito County. Goals are to promote community and preserve our heritage and natural beauty while encouraging commercial growth that will bring jobs and revenue to our County.

San Benito County Amateur Radio Association

To provide communication support for local government and community organizations in emergencies and other situations where our skills and equipment can be of public service.

San Benito County Business Council

Local business, agency, and government leaders committed to actively contributing to the economic vitality and wellbeing of the communities of San Benito County.

San Benito County Cattlemen's Association

Advocates for the cattle growers of San Benito County, promoting the safe, healthy production of beef and true conservation of habitat on which that production depends.

San Benito County Chamber of Commerce Foundation

Created under the umbrella of the San Benito County Chamber of Commerce & Visitors Bureau, the Foundation is organized for the purpose of creating, promoting, and celebrating the economic vitality of San Benito County by providing resources to businesses and individuals.

San Benito County Lodge # 211

The San Benito Lodge of Free and Accepted Masons, which sits as the cornerstone of Hollister, reminding us of the past and a time when a community was born.

San Benito County LULAC Council #2890

The mission of the League of United Latin American Citizens (LULAC) is to advance the economic condition, educational attainment, political influence, health and civil rights of Latino(a)s of the United States.

San Benito County Saddle Horse Association

Celebrating our proud county traditions and heritage of horse lovers throughout the county.

San Benito County Sheriff's Search and Rescue Unit

Assisting the Sheriff in search and rescue and to promoting goodwill among the residents of the county and elsewhere.

San Benito Dance Foundation

Providing dancers with financial hardships the opportunity to excel in the world of dance through education.

San Benito Fire Safe Council

Mobilizing people of San Benito County to protect their homes, communities, and environment from wildfires.

San Benito Health Foundation

Fulfilling the healthcare needs of the community in the San Benito County area.

San Benito Oriana Chorale

Giving live public performances to enhance the musical skills of chorale singers and support the development of the performing arts in our community.

San Benito Robotics

The mission of San Benito Robotics is to inspire young people to be science and technology leaders and innovators, by engaging them in exciting mentor-based programs that build science, engineering, and technology skills, that inspire innovation, and that foster well-rounded life capabilities including self-confidence, communication, and leadership.

San Benito Stage Company

Provides performing arts experiences that enrich the lives of its members and patrons. By providing educational opportunities in acting, dance, voice, and technical theatre. SBSC promotes theatre arts and community involvement through the challenge of creating theatrical productions.

San Juan Bautista Community Business Association

To promote economic vitality while maintaining the charm and history of San Juan Bautista.

San Juan Bautista Historical Society

Discovering, procuring and preserving whatever may relate to the natural, civil, ecclesiastical and architectural history of San Juan Bautista.

San Juan Bautista Library Auxiliary

The Auxiliary helps to support the children's programs at the Library.

San Juan Bautista Service Club

Supporting many wonderful events in San Juan Bautista with a large group of volunteers.

San Juan Home and School Club

Providing a strong sense of community through collaboration between parents and teachers who work in partnership to support our school.

San Juan-Aromas Tennis & Fitness

Supporting and promoting enrichment activities through tennis and fitness programs.

Senior Legal Services

Addressing the needs of the elderly who are unable to obtain legal aid services that address their unique problems.

Seniors Council of Santa Cruz and San Benito Counties

Enabling older persons to function with independence and dignity in their homes and in the community to their fullest capacity.

Sleep In Heavenly Peace

Building and delivering beds to children who do not have a bed. Our motto: "No kid sleeps on the floor in our town!"

Small Steps

Providing warm winter coats and shoes for children of San Benito County who may not otherwise receive them.

SNIP Mobile Spay and Neuter

A vet clinic on wheels offering high-quality, low-cost spay/neuter services to dogs and cats throughout California to end animal overpopulation.

Sons in Retirement (SIR) #131

A public benefit corporation formed for men. Mission is to improve the lives of the members through fun activities and events while making friends for life.

Sons of the American Legion Post #69

Sons of The American Legion exists to honor the service and sacrifice of Legionnaires.

South County Cal-Soap

Mission is to create educated communities, one underrepresented student at a time. We currently serve K-12 students at 29 schools in Morgan Hill, Gilroy, Aromas-San Juan, and San Benito School District.

290 I.O.O.F. Ave

Gilroy, CA 95020

South Valley Fleurs Garden Club

A Garden Club which funds garden projects in schools in San Benito, Gilroy & Morgan Hill Districts.

Southern California American Indian Resources (SCAIR Inc. )

Providing help to Native American, Native Alaskan, and Native Hawaiian individuals and families through both emergency and career/college services.

Southside Parent Club

Providing important news and information on the school board and parent club.

Special Parents Information Network (SPIN)

Serving parents, guardians, and families in Santa Cruz and San Benito Counties who have a child of any age with special needs.

Step Forward Foundation

Providing low-cost immigration representation to families and victims of violence.

Sun Street Centers

Preventing alcohol and drug addiction by offering education, prevention, treatment, and recovery to individuals and families regardless of income level.

Texas Masonic Lodge #46

Fostering personal growth and improving lives around the community and the world at large.

UC Cooperative Extension 4-H San Benito County

Youth program in which kids and teens complete hands-on projects in areas like health, science, agriculture, and civic engagement in a positive environment where they receive guidance from adult mentors and are encouraged to take on proactive leadership roles.

United for San Benito County

Transforming our community with a focus on improving processes and conditions to achieve community goals.

Valley Health Associates

Providing the highest quality substance use disorder services for youth and adults in Monterey and San Benito Counties.

Ventures

Promoting economic justice through financial capability, asset building, and advocacy.

Veterans of Foreign Wars Hollister Post #9242

Doing good things for deserving people in Hollister--our veterans, their families, and their communities.

Veterans of Foreign Wars Leslie L. Garratt Post #6359 San Juan Bautista

Doing good things for deserving people in San Juan Bautista--our veterans, their families, and their communities.

Wildfarmers

Wildfarmers bring people of all ages and diverse cultures together in a fun relaxed environment. With events and campouts and experiences designed to embed in the participants the joy and freedom that comes from being in close contact with nature.

Women's Club of Hollister

Partnering with other local agencies to create a positive impact in the community.

YMCA San Benito County

Embracing the values of caring, honesty, respect, and responsibility through programs that develop youth, support healthy living, and foster social responsibility.

Youth Alliance

Creating thriving and equitable communities through services that equip youth and families to become change agents in their own lives and in their community.

Youth Recovery Connections

Offering intervention, prevention, and services for those suffering from opioid and other substance use disorders. Youth Recovery Connections offers an individualized and evidence-based approach provided in a safe, caring, and supportive environment.
